Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.

ALLEGATION: Agency included/identified reporting source in their report. This
information is confidential.
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported that Staff 1 of this agency completed a special evaluation report that
included the identification of the referral source that initiated the special evaluation of a
foster home and Supervisor 1 of this agency reviewed and signed/approved the special
evaluation report.
A copy of the foster home special evaluation report was received and reviewed. The
allegation section of the report appeared to be a copy of an email that was received
from the referral source indicating the allegations/basis for the complaint. This email
was lengthy and appeared to be unedited to the extent that the referral source was
readily identifiable.
I interviewed State Worker 1 by telephone on 0924/2021. State Worker 1 stated the
expectations of how confidentiality is handled has changed over time with the most
recent changes occurring in Act 116 in March of 2018. State Worker 1 stated she did
not know when Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 may have attended the special evaluation
training provided by the state, but any possible noncompliance may be a training issue
related to the changes and current expectations associated with confidentiality.
I interviewed Administrator 1 and Supervisor 1 by telephone on 09/29/2021. Supervisor
1 stated she was unsure of when she had previously attended the special evaluation
training, but her most recent participation was in 2013. Supervisor 1 stated this was an
issue that the staff has had difficulty with in how to provide a comprehensive
presentation of allegations that may be received without identifying the referral source of
the allegations. Supervisor 1 stated she would forward her related training information
and the training information for Staff 1 to me as a part of this investigation.
The training information was received from Supervisor 1 on 09/29/2021. This
information indicated Supervisor 1 last attended the foster home complaint training
provided by the state on October 30, 2013, and Staff 1 attended certification and
complaint training in January 2018.
APPLICABLE RULE
Act 116 Person making report, cooperating in investigation, or
722.115l (2) assisting in other requirement; immunity from liability;
confidentiality; anonymous complaint; false report.
Except as provided in section 10(3), the identity of a person
making a report and cooperating with or assisting the
department relative to that report under this act is
3

confidential, subject only to disclosure with the consent of
that person or by judicial process.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the agency staff did
complete/approve a foster home evaluation that included
information that identified the referral source for the complaint in
violation of the need to maintain the confidentiality of this
information.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The findings also indicated Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 attended
training related to this issue prior to the effective date of the
current expectations related to confidentiality. It is
recommended that the facility have licensing workers and
supervisors attend certification and complaint training again
given it has been 8 years since they attended and CPA rules
and Act 116 have been amended since then.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child placing agency-private be maintained.
